column3: et discèrne caŭsam meam de gente non sancta~; ab hòmine iníqŭo et dolóso érue me. ^ Judge me
column5: and distinguish my cause from the nation that is not holy~; deliver me from the unjust and deceitful man.
dum afflígit me inimícus~? ^ For thou art
column7: my strength~; why hast thou cast me off
column8: and why do I go sorrowful

column1: 3 ^ Emìtte lucem tuam et veritátem tuam~; ìpsa me deduxérunt
column2: et adduxérunt in mòntem sanctum tuum et in tabernácula tua. ^ Send forth thy light and thy truth~; these have conducted me
column3: and they brought me unto thy holy hill and into thy tabernacles.

column2: ad Deum qŭi laĕtìficat juventútem meam. Confitébor tìbi in cìttara Deus
column3: Deus meus. ^ And I will go in to the altar of God
column4: to God who giveth joy to my youth. To thee
column6: I will give praise upon the harp.

column3: et quare contùrbas me~?  ^ Why art thou sad
column4: O my soul~? And why dost thou disquiet me~?
et Deus meus. ^ Hope in God
column5: for I will still give praise to him
